channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Gaza ceasefire deal violated. And, shutdown enters day 20 with no end in sight
item.description: Israel and Hamas say they are committed to the ceasefire after clashes over the weekend. And, lawmakers not feeling the pressures of the government shutdown.
item.content:encoded:
Israel and Hamas say they are committed to the ceasefire after clashes over the weekend. And, lawmakers not feeling the pressures of the government shutdown.

(Image credit: Eyad Baba)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: As deadline for Trump's colleges compact looms, schools signal dissent
item.description: Of the original nine schools that received the Trump administration's Compact for Academic Excellence in Higher Education, the majority have indicated they are not planning on signing.
item.content:encoded:
Of the original nine schools that received the Trump administration's Compact for Academic Excellence in Higher Education, the majority have indicated they are not planning on signing.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: Can collagen supplements improve your skin? Here's what the research shows
item.description: With age comes wisdom. And wrinkles. And joint pain. In wellness circles, the buzz is that collagen supplements can help with all these concerns. But are these claims something you should swallow?
item.content:encoded:
With age comes wisdom. And wrinkles. And joint pain. In wellness circles, the buzz is that collagen supplements can help with all these concerns. But are these claims something you should swallow?

(Image credit: Luis Echeverri Urrea)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Centrist Rodrigo Paz wins Bolivia's presidential runoff, topping right-wing rival
item.description: Centrist senator Rodrigo Paz won Bolivia's presidency with 54% of the vote, ending 20 years of rule by the Movement Toward Socialism party amid economic turmoil.
item.content:encoded:
Centrist senator Rodrigo Paz won Bolivia's presidency with 54% of the vote, ending 20 years of rule by the Movement Toward Socialism party amid economic turmoil.

(Image credit: Natacha Pisarenko)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump announces tariffs and an end to U.S. aid to Colombia amid clash over drug trade
item.description: The U.S. will slash assistance to Colombia and enact tariffs on its exports because the country's leader, Gustavo Petro, "does nothing to stop" drug production, President Donald Trump said Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. will slash assistance to Colombia and enact tariffs on its exports because the country's leader, Gustavo Petro, "does nothing to stop" drug production, President Donald Trump said Sunday.

(Image credit: Fernando Vergara)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Sam Rivers, bassist and founding member of Limp Bizkit, dies aged 48
item.description: "Sam Rivers wasn't just our bass player — he was pure magic. The pulse beneath every song, the calm in the chaos, the soul in the sound," Limp Bizkit said in a social media post Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
"Sam Rivers wasn't just our bass player — he was pure magic. The pulse beneath every song, the calm in the chaos, the soul in the sound," Limp Bizkit said in a social media post Saturday.

(Image credit: Kevin Winter)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Israel strikes Gaza as both Israel and Hamas accuse each other of breaching ceasefire
item.description: Israel said Sunday it responded after "terrorists" attacked troops operating in the Rafah area with gunfire and an anti-tank missile. Hamas said it was unaware of the clashes.
item.content:encoded:
Israel said Sunday it responded after "terrorists" attacked troops operating in the Rafah area with gunfire and an anti-tank missile. Hamas said it was unaware of the clashes.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Masked thieves steal 'priceless' jewels from the Louvre Museum
item.description: French Interior Minister Laurent Nuñez called the heist "a major, highly organized operation" that lasted just seven minutes. Authorities were still drawing up the value of the stolen items.
item.content:encoded:
French Interior Minister Laurent Nuñez called the heist "a major, highly organized operation" that lasted just seven minutes. Authorities were still drawing up the value of the stolen items.

(Image credit: Alexander Turnbull)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Grab the goggles. Pickleball eye injuries are on the rise
item.description: Safety precautions haven't caught up with enthusiasm for the sport. Researchers call for a new push for eye-ware.
item.content:encoded:
Safety precautions haven't caught up with enthusiasm for the sport. Researchers call for a new push for eye-ware.

(Image credit: Stefania Pelfini la Waziya/Moment RF)
item.dc:creator: Arundathi Nair

item.title: ICE tried to send one immigrant to a country he never lived in. Then he lawyered up.
item.description: Roman Surovtsev is like many others who were detained at their regularly scheduled ICE check-ins. What makes his case different is that his wife has marshalled a team of lawyers on his behalf.
item.content:encoded:
Roman Surovtsev is like many others who were detained at their regularly scheduled ICE check-ins. What makes his case different is that his wife has marshalled a team of lawyers on his behalf.

(Image credit: Credit: Surovtsev family)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo
